name: addendum
description: Addendum provides some benefit to the spell being cast if it was cast during your main phase. [Unofficial]

name: battalion
description: Battalion refers to an ability like "Whenever this creature and at least two other creatures attack, [effect]." [Unofficial]

name: bloodrush
description: Bloodrush refers to an ability like "[Cost], Discard this card: Target attacking creature gets [effect]." [Unofficial]

name: channel
description: Channel refers to an ability like "[Cost], Discard this card: [Effect]." [Unofficial]

name: chroma
description: Chroma refers to an ability that counts the number of mana symbols of a given color in the mana costs of a set of objects. [Unofficial]

name: cohort
description: Cohort refers to an ability like "{T}, Tap an untapped Ally you control: [Effect]." [Unofficial]

name: constellation
description: Constellation refers to an ability like "Whenever this permanent or another enchantment enters the battlefield under your control, [effect]." [Unofficial]

name: converge
description: Converge appears on spells whose effects depend on the number of colors of mana spent to cast them. [Unofficial]

name: council's dilemma
description: Council's Dilemma allows players to vote, and has varying effects based on the number of votes for each option. [Unofficial]

name: delirium
description: Delirium refers to an ability that checks if there are four or more card types in your graveyard. [Unofficial]

name: domain
description: Domain refers to an ability that varies with the number of basic land types you control. [Unofficial]

name: eminence
description: Eminence refers to an ability that functions while the card is either in the command zone or on the battlefield. [Unofficial]

name: enrage
description: Enrage refers to an ability like "Whenever this permanent is dealt damage, [effect]." [Unofficial]

name: fateful hour
description: Fateful Hour refers to an ability with an increased effect if you have 5 or less life. [Unofficial]

name: ferocious
description: Ferocious refers to an ability with an increased effect if you control a creature with power 4 or greater. [Unofficial]

name: formidable
description: Formidable refers to an ability that can only be activated if you control creatures with total power 8 or greater. [Unofficial]

name: grandeur
description: Grandeur refers to an ability like "Discard another card named ~: [Effect]." [Unofficial]

name: hellbent
description: Hellbent refers to an ability or effect that is only active if you have no cards in your hand. [Unofficial]

name: heroic
description: Heroic refers to an ability like "Whenever you cast a spell that targets this creature, [effect]." [Unofficial]

name: imprint
description: Imprint refers to an ability which lets you exile some number of cards and then has some effect which references the characteristics of the cards that were exiled. [Unofficial]

name: inspired
description: Inspired refers to an ability like "Whenever this creature becomes untapped, [effect]." [Unofficial]

name: join forces
description: Join Forces is found on spells which let each player pay any amount of mana, and then each player benefits from the spell. [Unofficial]

name: kinship
description: Kinship refers to an ability like "At the beginning of your upkeep, you may look at the top card of your library. If it shares a creature type with this permanent, you may reveal it. If you do, [effect]." [Unofficial]

name: landfall
description: Landfall refers to triggered abilities that trigger when a land enters the battlefield under your control. [Unofficial]

name: lieutenant
description: Lieutenant refers to an effect that is only active if you control your commander. [Unofficial]

name: metalcraft
description: Metalcraft confers some benefit to a spell, ability, or permanent if you control three or more artifacts. [Unofficial]

name: morbid
description: Morbid refers to an effect or ability that is only active if a creature died this turn. [Unofficial]

name: parley
description: Parley refers to abilities which have all players reveal the top card of their library, and the effect varies with the number of nonland cards revealed this way. [Unofficial]

name: radiance
description: Radiance refers to spells or effects that affect their target and each other permanent of the same type that shares a color with it. [Unofficial]

name: raid
description: Raid refers to an ability which gives a card different or additional characteristics if the player has attacked with a creature that turn. [Unofficial]

name: rally
description: Rally refers to an ability like "Whenever this card or another Ally enters the battlefield under your control, [effect]." [Unofficial]

name: revolt
description: Revolt refers to a effect or ability that is only active if a permanent you controlled left the battlefield this turn. [Unofficial]

name: spell mastery
description: Spell Mastery provides some benefit to a spell if its controller has two or more instant or sorcery cards in their graveyard. [Unofficial]

name: strive
description: Strive lets you pay additional mana to allow a spell to have additional targets. [Unofficial]

name: sweep
description: Sweep refers to an ability which lets you return any number of cards you control of a single basic land type to their owners' hands, then the effect varies with the number of lands returned this way. [Unofficial]

name: tempting offer
description: Tempting Offer lets a player take an action, then offers the player's opponents the same action. The original player takes the action again for each opponent who chose to do so. [Unofficial]

name: threshold
description: Threshold gives a card different or additional characteristics if its controller has seven or more cards in their graveyard. [Unofficial]

name: undergrowth
description: Undergrowth refers to an ability which varies based on the number of creature cards in its controller's graveyard. [Unofficial]

name: will of the council
description: Will of the Council lets players vote on an outcome and the outcome/s with the highest number of votes happens. [Unofficial]
